info.title: Infoconnect API
info.description: Infoconnect our API platform, ensures you have the data you need when you need it to make quick, intelligent business decisions and stay a step ahead of competitors. Below are all the endpoints available to query the Infogroup business and consumer databases.

parameters.name: city
parameters.description: Filters through the Companies collection by city name.

parameters.name: companyname
parameters.description: Filters through the Companies collection and returns resources by company name.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: The content type.

parameters.name: ein
parameters.description: Filters through the Companies collection and returns resources with an Employer Identification Number (EIN).

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: Filters through the Companies collection and returns resources with a case-insensitive email address match at the level.

parameters.name: firstname
parameters.description: Filters through the Companies collection by the primary contacts first name.

parameters.name: lastname
parameters.description: Filters through the Companies collection by the primary contacts last name.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of responses to return. If used, must be a number between 1 and 10. Default is 10.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Number of responses to be skipped for generating the output. If used, must be a number between 0-100 minus limit. Default is 0.

parameters.name: phone
parameters.description: Filters through the Companies collection and returns resources with an ten-digit phone number match.

parameters.name: postalcode
parameters.description: Filters through the Companies collection by ZIP code or Postal code.

parameters.name: resourcetype
parameters.description: Identifies the resource type for the response. The default value basic returns a base resource type that is valid across all methods; the resource type parameter is not needed to produce this response. To get a more detailed response set the resource type parameter to enhanced. To retrieve resources with Ids only, set the resource type parameter to core.

parameters.name: stateprovince
parameters.description: Filters through the Companies collection by State or Province abbreviation.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: The content type.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: The content type.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: The content type.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A nine to ten digit Infogroup identification number. A number referencing the company assigned by Infogroup. This number will always refer to a single company and the reference will never change, unless the resource is permanently removed. Requesting a record by {id} will always return zero or one response.

parameters.name: resourcetype
parameters.description: Identifies the resource type for the response. The default value basic returns a base resource type that is valid across all methods; the resource type parameter is not needed to produce this response. To get a more detailed response set the resource type parameter to enhanced. To retrieve resources with Ids only, set the resource type parameter to core.

parameters.name: city
parameters.description: Filters through the People collection by city name.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: The content type.

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: Filters through the People collection and returns resources with a case-insensitive email address match at the level.

parameters.name: emailsha1upper
parameters.description: Filters through the People collection and returns resources with a case-insensitive email address match at the level. If used, must be a SHA1 hashed upper case email address.

parameters.name: firstname
parameters.description: Filters through the People collection by the primary contacts first name.

parameters.name: includehistoricalemail
parameters.description: IncludeHistoricalEmail can only be used in combination with Email or EmailSha1Upper. IncludeHistoricalEmail is used to retrieve historical records. Including this limits the ResourceType to Basic only. These records do not have an Id therefore cannot be used to return an Enhanced ResourceType. If used, must be True or False. Default is False.

parameters.name: lastname
parameters.description: Filters through the People collection by the primary contacts last name.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of responses to return. If used, must be a number between 1 and 10. Default is 10.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Number of responses to be skipped for generating the output. If used, must be a number between 0-100 minus limit. Default is 0.

parameters.name: phone
parameters.description: Filters through the People collection and returns resources with an ten-digit phone number match.

parameters.name: postalcode
parameters.description: Filters through the People collection by ZIP code or Postal code.

parameters.name: resourcetype
parameters.description: Identifies the resource type for the response. The default value basic returns a base resource type that is valid across all methods; the resource type parameter is not needed to produce this response. To get a more detailed response set the resource type parameter to enhanced. To retrieve resources with Ids only, set the resource type parameter to core. Additional ResourceTypes are Core, LifeStyle and TargetReady.

parameters.name: stateprovince
parameters.description: Filters through the People collection by State or Province abbreviation.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: The content type.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: The content type.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: The content type.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A twelve digit Infogroup identification number. A number referencing the individual assigned by Infogroup. This number will always refer to a single individual and the reference will never change, unless the resource is permanently removed. Requesting a record by {id} will always return zero or one response.

parameters.name: resourcetype
parameters.description: Identifies the resource type for the response. The default value basic returns a base resource type that is valid across all methods; the resource type parameter is not needed to produce this response. To get a more detailed response set the resource type parameter to enhanced. To retrieve resources with Ids only, set the resource type parameter to core. Additional ResourceTypes are Core, LifeStyle and TargetReady.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: The content type.

parameters.name: keyword
parameters.description: By SIC description. Example barber.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: The content type.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A two, four, or six numeric Standard Identification Classification (SIC) code.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: The content type.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: The content type.
